intro: Aerva lanata var. pseudojavanica, commonly known as the Java nettle or false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along waterways. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
